noun.description: A burrowing rodent with fur-lined pouches on the outside of the cheeks, found in North and Central America.
A tortoise of dry sandy regions that excavates tunnels as shelter from the sun, native to the southern US.
A menu-based system for Internet searching and document retrieval, largely superseded by the World Wide Web.

origin: Late 18th century: perhaps from Canadian French gaufre honeycomb (because the gopher honeycombs the ground with its burrows).
